CatDescriptText: Mrs. James DeMarco, housewife, Heidelberg and Mrs. Fannie Moncrief, housewife, Beltzhoover, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, August 26, 1961, pg. 1 with question: "Do you think there will be war over Berlin?"  Mrs. DeMarco's answer reads: "I think there will be a war, but I hope we can get things under control before something like that happens."  Mrs. Moncrief's answer reads: "I don't think so.  There will be a meeting of the minds and they will reach some sort of an agreement."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mrs. James DeMarco wearing gingham dress, standing in front of building; Portrait of Fannie Moncrief wearing lattice patterned blouse, beaded necklace, eyeglasses, and hair net, standing in front building
